Model.Playground

Interface IOwnPlayground

  • All Superinterfaces:
    IPlayground
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    OwnPlayground

    public interface IOwnPlayground
extends IPlayground

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.ArrayList<IShip> getShipListOfThisPlayground() 
      IShip isShipPlacementValid(Point startPoint, Point endPoint)
      Checks if the ship represented by these two points is valid if the ship placement is valid the method creates the ship and adds it to the shipList itself
      boolean isValidPlacement(Point startPoint, Point endPoint)
      This method only checks whether the ship (represented by start and endpoint) can be placed or not In both cases no ship is created
      IShip moveShip(IShip shipToMove, Point newStartPoint, Point newEndpoint)
      Use this method, when the player wants to switch the position of his ship on the selection
      void setShipListOfThisPlayground(java.util.ArrayList<IShip> shipListOfThisPlayground) 
      ShotResponse shoot(Point pos_shot)
      Use this method when the enemy shoots at our playground Manages all necessary actions, when and shot occurs on our playground

      • Methods inherited from interface Model.Playground.IPlayground

        buildPlayground, drawPlayground, resetAll, setLabels

    • Method Detail

      • shoot

        ShotResponse shoot(Point pos_shot)
        Use this method when the enemy shoots at our playground Manages all necessary actions, when and shot occurs on our playground
        Parameters:
        pos_shot - The position, where the enemy wants to hit our playground
        Returns:
        Returns an ShotResponseObject containing three booleans: gameLost: True if the game is over, because we lost all our ships hit: True one of our ships got hit shipDestroyed: True, if on of our ships got hit and got destroyed

      • isShipPlacementValid

        IShip isShipPlacementValid(Point startPoint,
                           Point endPoint)
        Checks if the ship represented by these two points is valid if the ship placement is valid the method creates the ship and adds it to the shipList itself
        Parameters:
        startPoint - The start point of the ship, which needs to be checked
        endPoint - The end point of the ship, which needs to be checked
        Returns:
        The ship if the placement is valid. In any other case null

      • moveShip

        IShip moveShip(IShip shipToMove,
               Point newStartPoint,
               Point newEndpoint)
        Use this method, when the player wants to switch the position of his ship on the selection
        Parameters:
        shipToMove - The current ship the player wants to move to another position
        newStartPoint - The startPosition, where the player wants to move the ship
        newEndpoint - The endPosition, where the player wants to move the ship
        Returns:
        IShip, if the ship movement was correct, null if the movement is not allowed

      • isValidPlacement

        boolean isValidPlacement(Point startPoint,
                         Point endPoint)
        This method only checks whether the ship (represented by start and endpoint) can be placed or not In both cases no ship is created
        Parameters:
        startPoint - The start point of the ship
        endPoint - The end point of the ship
        Returns:
        true, if placement is allowed

      • getShipListOfThisPlayground

        java.util.ArrayList<IShip> getShipListOfThisPlayground()

      • setShipListOfThisPlayground

        void setShipListOfThisPlayground(java.util.ArrayList<IShip> shipListOfThisPlayground)
